intro: Phlomoides liangwangshanensis, commonly known as the Liangwangshan phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue to purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to specific ecological conditions.
